page.title: 14HOUSES
page.content: Several old barns have been converted into modern houses,features such as decorative tiles along the ridge of the old barns have been used on the roofs of the new houses.Two of the children live in a converted barn and have discovered that after the harvest was gathered in dancing was held in what is now their kitchen. Several names of houses in the village show what was traditionally done there for example Sawpits,Malthouse and Smithy Cottages.At the end of School Lane is the site of the former village bakery.Many villagers regret it closing.It is now the site of the a village shop.Outside is a telephone box,there is also a Post Office and store in School Lane. The Methodist Church was built in 1914 A lay preacher takes the weekly service the minister lives in Weymouth
